Remove juices from the burner and dissolve jello in the juice.  Let juice cool.  

Mix cream cheese, cherries, & pineapple.  Add to jello.  

Then pour in coke.  

Pour mixture into a bowl and chill until firm.

recipeDescription: Ken and I both liked this dressing.  It was easy to make and was really good.  Thanksgiving 2022
ingredientList:
3 cups crumbled cornbread
2 tablespoons butter
1 small onion, diced
1/2 cup chopped celery
2 large eggs, beaten
2 cups chicken broth
1 tablespoon dried sage
1 dash salt
1 dash pepper
recipeText:
For the cornbread I used one box of Jiffy cornbread mix. It make about 3 cups and was the perfect amount. However, this dressing went fast (even with only Ken and I eating it), so a double batch might be desired.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Grease a 7x11-inch baking dish.

Place crumbled cornbread in a large bowl.

Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and celery and sauté until soft, 5 to 7 minutes.

Add sautéed onion and celery to the crumbled cornbread.

Stir in chicken stock, eggs, sage, salt, and pepper until well combined. Pour dressing into the prepared baking dish.

Bake in the preheated oven until dressing just starts to turn golden brown around the edges, about 30 minutes.

ingredientList:
1/4 cup sugar
1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar
1 16-ounce carton heavy cream
Romaine lettuce
recipeText:
Whip the cream into semi-thick consistency, add sugar and vinegar and whip until mixed. 

Chop lettuce and mix into cream mixture.  Serve.

ingredientList:
2 cups cottage cheese
9 ounces cool whip
1 3-ounce box orange jello
1 11-ounce can mandarin oranges
1 20-ounce can pineapple tidbits
1/2 cup maraschino cherries
recipeText:
Mix cottage cheese, cool whip and orange jello.

Add fruit and mix all together. 

Chill 2 hours.

recipeDescription: This tastes like the pasta slaw at Nordy's BBQ.  Super simple to make!
ingredientList:
7 ounces ditalini pasta
1 16-ounce bag Tri-Color coleslaw mix
1 medium onion, finely chopped
2 celery ribs, finely chopped
1 medium cucumber, finely chopped
1 green bell pepper finely chopped

DRESSING:
1 1/3 cups mayonnaise
1/3 cup sugar
1/4 cup apple cider vinegar
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
recipeText:
1. Cook pasta, drain, rinse, cool, and place in large bowl.
2. Combine remaining salad ingredients.
3. In a separate bowl, blend all dressing ingredients and pour over the top of salad.
4. Mix thoroughly and refrigerate until ready to eat.  A couple hours in the fridge helps the dressing flavors combine.


I usually make it with just the pasta, coleslaw mix, and onion.  It still tastes great!

ingredientList:
1 (12-ounce) package tri-colored rotini
1 jar basil pesto (be careful, many use cashews and pistachios instead of pine nuts)
2 cups cherry tomatoes, cut in half
1/8 cup finely diced red onions (optional)
1 (8-ounce) can black olives, drained
1/4 cup freshly grated parmesan cheese
1/2 cup fresh mozzarella, cut into 1/2 inch cubes (optional)
1 dash salt
1 dash pepper
recipeText:
1.) Cook pasta according to package. Drain and rinse with cold water.

2.) Add pasta to large bowl and stir in pesto.

3.) Add remaining ingredients, mix.

4.) Refrigerate for at least an hour before serving.

ingredientList:
Tuna Macaroni Salad
1 16-ounce bag macaroni, cooked, drained, cooled
1 9-ounce package tuna
2 bread and butter pickles
1/4 cup miracle whip
recipeText: Mix the above ingredients together.  Serve cold.

recipeDescription:
Dylan didn't like these.  Too spicy. 
Kailey liked them the same as any scone.
Melissa thought they were okay.  Better than some but not as good as others.
Ken liked them equally as well as others.
ingredientList:
2 3/4 cups all-purpose flour
1/3 cup granulated sugar
1 tablespoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
3/4 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1 teaspoon ground ginger
1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
1/4 teaspoon ground allspice (or cardamom)
1 medium pear, peeled, cored, and diced
1/2 cup unsalted butter, cold and cut into pieces
1 tablespoon vanilla extract
1 cup buttermilk, cold  (1 TBSP lemon juice or white distilled vinegar, and enough milk to make 1 cup)
1 tablespoon heavy cream
recipeText:
In a large bowl, whisk the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, and cardamom together. 

Cut the butter into the flour using a pastry blender, 2 knives, or your fingertips. The mixture should look like coarse crumbs. Gently fold in the pears.

Whisk the vanilla and buttermilk together and gradually add it to the flour mixture. Stir just until the dough comes together. You may not need all the buttermilk. Add a little at a time until the mixture is moist but not too wet. Do not over mix the dough or the scones will be tough.

Transfer the dough to a lightly floured surface and gently knead the dough four or five times. Pat the dough into a 7-inch round circle.

Cut the circle in half, then cut each half into four triangle-shaped wedges. Arrange the scones 2 inches apart on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Place the scones in the freezer for 30 minutes.

Position the oven rack in the center of the oven and heat to 400 degrees F. Brush the tops of the scones with cream. 
Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Transfer to a wire rack to cool and drizzle with glaze. Scones are best enjoyed right away.



Notes
Don't add all the liquid at once. Depending on the humidity and the brand of flour you are using, you may need less liquid than what is called for. Add just enough to moisten the dry ingredients until they hold together when squeezed.

Dice the pear into small pieces. Smaller pieces will make it easier to cut the dough into triangles.

Make sure butter and milk are cold when adding it to the recipe.

Freeze the shaped scones for 30 minutes before baking. This helps the scones keep their shape and ensures the butter isn't too warm before going into the oven.

This recipe yields 8 large scones. For smaller scones, cut the dough into 16 pieces instead of 8. Watch the scones closely as they bake because smaller scones may require a shorter baking time.

Make Ahead Tip
You can refrigerate the dough overnight then simply shape the scones and bake them the next day.
The dough can also be frozen for up to 2 months. Freeze the dough on a baking sheet as directed in step 5 then wrap in plastic wrap and store in a freezer bag. When ready to make the scones, preheat the oven and baked as directed. There's no need to thaw the dough.
You can keep leftover scones for up to 2 days in the refrigerator.
Unglazed scones can be frozen for up to three months. Thaw in the refrigerator overnight then reheat and glaze before serving.

Buttermilk is a favored product in high altitude baking because it contribute acidity as well as richness, moisture, flavor, and tenderness. If a sea-level recipe calls for regular milk, you can replace it with buttermilk. Acidity weakens the elasticity and/or strength of gluten in wheat flour, thereby keeping baked products tender.

ingredientList:
Scones:
3 cups flour
2 sticks (1 cup) butter, cold (or frozen) and grated
2/3 cup granulated sugar
1 1/2 tablespoons baking powder
1 tablespoon poppy seeds

2/3 cup heavy cream *(plus 1 TBSP)
1 tablespoon lemon extract
1/3 cup water
1 large egg

Lemon Glaze:
2 cups powdered sugar
3 tablespoons milk  or water (so refrigeration is not necessary)
1/2 teaspoon lemon extract
1 pinch poppy seeds
recipeText:
1.  For the scones: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone mats.

2.  Sift together the flour, granulated sugar and baking powder. Cut the cold butter into pats, then use a pastry cutter or 2 knives to cut the butter into the flour mixture. Keep going until the mixture is crumbly, then stir in the poppy seeds.

3.  Mix together the heavy cream, lemon extract, water, and egg in a small pitcher. Stir the wet ingredients into the flour mixture with a fork or spatula just until the dough comes together.

4.  Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and lightly press it together until it forms a rough rectangle (the mixture will be pretty crumbly). Use a rolling pin to roll into a rectangle about 12 inches by 7 inches and 1/2 to 3/4 inch thick. Use your hands to help with the forming if necessary. Then cut the rectangle into 12 symmetrical rectangles, first cutting lengthwise into 3 strips and then across into 4 strips. Next, cut each rectangle in half diagonally, to form 2 triangles. Transfer to the prepared baking sheets.

5.  Bake until cooked through but not yet golden, about 16 minutes. Allow to cool for 10 minutes on the baking sheets, then transfer to a cooling rack to cool completely.

Bake scones right before you plan to enjoy them. If you'd like to get ahead, you can make and shape the dough into scones ahead of time and leave them in the fridge overnight. Or you can freeze them on a baking sheet, transfer the frozen unbaked scones to a zip-top bag, and bake them straight from frozen, adding a couple of minutes to the baking time

6.  For the lemon glaze: Whisk together the powdered sugar, milk, lemon zest and juice and salt until completely smooth, adding more milk if needed for thinning.

7.  Dip the scones in the glaze, then sprinkle with poppy seeds. Allow the glaze to set completely before serving.  

*Note: Melissa usually adds 1 extra TBSP of cream as this is a bit too crumbly, and you really have to work the dough to get it to stick.

recipeName: Pear and Ginger Scones - No Cream
recipeDescription:
Ken liked these because they have fruit in them.  
Melissa thought they were bland and tasteless.
ingredientList:
Scones:
2 cups unbleached all-purpose flour, plus more for shaping
2 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1/3 cup granulated sugar (plus 1 TBSP if using ground ginger)
1/4 teaspoon fine sea salt
6 tablespoons unsalted butter, cold, cut in small cubes
1 cup Pacific Northwest Canned Pears, halves or slices, in juice, drained and juice reserved
3/8 tsp ground ginger (or 3 tablespoons finely chopped crystallized ginger)
1 large egg

Pear Glaze:
1 cup confectioner’s sugar
1 to 2 tablespoons reserved Pacific Northwest Canned Pear juice
1 teaspoon finely grated lemon zest
recipeText:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.

Combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, sugar and salt in a large bowl and mix well. Using a food processor or 2 knives, cut the butter into the dry ingredients until the mixture resembles coarse meal with pea-sized pieces of butter. Stir in the pears and ginger.

In a small bowl, whisk the egg and add 1/2 cup reserved pear juice mixing well to combine.

Pour the egg and pear juice into the butter and flour mixing just to combine and begin to create a cohesive mass.

Turn the contents of the bowl out onto a clean work surface generously dusted with flour and use a floured rolling pin to gently work the dough into a 12 by 4-inch rectangle. Cut the rectangle into six 4 by 3-inch triangles.

Arrange the scones on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake 18 to 20 minutes, or until golden brown. Remove the pan from heat and let scones cool slightly before sprinkling with confectioners sugar or drizzling with Pear Glaze.

PEAR GLAZE
Combine the confectioners sugar, pear juice and lemon zest in a bowl and whisk until smooth.


*Crystallized ginger is known as candied ginger or glace (ice) ginger (it looks like it's coated in ice crystals). It's basically fresh ginger that has been cooked in sugar water and rolled in sugar.

recipeDescription: A yummy scone recipe for a variety of fruits.
ingredientList:
Scones:
4 cups flour
1 cup granulated sugar
1 teaspoon salt
5 teaspoons baking powder
2 sticks (8 oz) butter, cold (or frozen) and grated
1 cup heavy cream
2 eggs
3 teaspoons vanilla extract
2 cups berries, nuts, fruit

Glaze:
2 cups powdered sugar
3 tablespoons water
1/2 teaspoon vanilla
recipeText:
1. Whisk flour, sugar, salt, and baking powder together in a large bowl. Grate the frozen butter using a box grater. Add it to the flour mixture and combine with a pastry cutter, two forks, or your fingers until the mixture comes together in pea-sized crumbs.  Place in the refrigerator or freezer as you mix the wet ingredients together.

2. Whisk 1/2 cup heavy cream, the egg, and vanilla extract together in a small bowl. Drizzle over the flour mixture, add the add-ins, then mix together until everything appears moistened.

3. Put mixture onto the counter and, with floured hands, work dough into a ball as best you can. Dough will be sticky. If it's too sticky, add a little more flour. If it seems too dry, add 1-2 more Tablespoons heavy cream. 

Press into an 8-inch disc and, with a sharp knife or bench scraper, cut into 16 wedges. For smaller scones, press dough into two discs and cut each into 16 wedges. 

4. Brush scones with remaining heavy cream and for extra crunch, sprinkle with coarse sugar. (You can do this before or after refrigerating in the next step.)

5. Place scones on a plate or lined baking sheet (if your fridge has space!) and refrigerate for at least 15 minutes.

6. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 400 degrees F.

7. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.  After refrigerating, arrange scones 2-3 inches apart on the prepared baking sheets.

8. Bake for 18-26 minutes or until golden brown around the edges and lightly browned on top. Larger scones take closer to 25 minutes. 
     Remove from the oven and cool for a few minutes before topping with optional toppings listed in the ingredients.

9. Leftover scones keep well at room temperature for 2 days or in the refrigerator for 5 days.

Bake scones right before you plan to enjoy them. If you'd like to get ahead, you can make and shape the dough into scones ahead of time and leave them in the fridge overnight. Or you can freeze them on a baking sheet, transfer the frozen unbaked scones to a zip-top bag, and bake them straight from frozen, adding a couple of minutes to the baking time.

recipeDescription: This is really good with the pumpkin glaze.  Also see the Cinnamon Cream Cheese Frosting recipe.
ingredientList:
For the Scones:
1/2 cup pumpkin puree, (canned pumpkin puree, not pumpkin pie filling)
3 tablespoons heavy cream
1 large egg
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
2 cups all-purpose flour, spooned and leveled
1/3 cup brown sugar
2 teaspoons pumpkin pie spice
1 tsp cinnamon (optional, included in other recipes)
1 & 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup unsalted butter, cold and cubed

For the White Glaze:
1 cup powdered sugar
2-3 tablespoons heavy cream

For the Pumpkin Glaze:
3/4 cup powdered sugar
1 & 1/2 teaspoons pumpkin pie spice
1 tablespoon pumpkin puree
2 tablespoons heavy cream
recipeText:
Make the Scones:
Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a baking sheet with a silicone baking mat or parchment paper.

In a small mixing bowl, whisk together the pumpkin, heavy cream, egg, and vanilla; set it aside.

In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, brown sugar, pumpkin pie spice, baking powder, and salt until combined. Cut the butter into the flour mixture using a pastry cutter or your hands until you get pea-size crumbs. Make a well in the center, then pour in the wet pumpkin mixture; stir until the dough just starts to come together.

Dust the counter lightly with flour and place the dough onto the surface. Gently knead the dough a few times until it just comes together. Don't over-work the dough. Shape into a circle about 1-inch thick, then cut into 8 equal wedges. Place them on the baking sheet, leaving spaces in between them.

Bake 14-18 minutes until no longer wet, lightly golden, and cooked through. (If your oven runs hot, start checking at 14 minutes. Keep an eye on them – if they’re golden on top and bottom, they’re done.) Allow the scones to cool right on the baking sheet for 5 minutes, then transfer them to a cooling rack to cool completely.


Make the White Glaze:
In a small mixing bowl, combine the powdered sugar and 2 tablespoons of the heavy cream until there are no lumps. The glaze should be on the thicker side but still pourable; you can add in a little more heavy cream if it's too thick.
Spoon the glaze over the surface of each scone and allow the glaze to set for about 15 to 20 minutes.


Make the Pumpkin Glaze:
In a small mixing bowl, whisk together the powdered sugar and pumpkin pie spice. Mix in the puree and heavy cream, stir until the glaze is lump-free.
Pour the glaze into a ziploc bag and cut a small tip off the bottom of the bag. Drizzle the glaze back and forward over the scones. Allow the glaze to set for at least 15 minutes until it sets.


NOTE: Make sure the glaze sets/dries completely before applying the next. If you add the pumpkin glaze right on top of the wet white glaze, it will just run together. However, it will not affect the flavor, just the look.

ingredientList:
1/4 cup unsalted butter, frozen
1 cup frozen raspberries
1 cup + 1 tablespoon cold heavy cream
2 cups all-purpose flour
1/4 cup granulated sugar
2 3/4 teaspoons baking powder
3/4 teaspoon fine sea salt
1 1/2 tablespoons sparkling sugar, for the top
recipeText:
* Note: Thaw and drain the raspberries before adding to the dough.  They can be very wet so I recommend a 1/2 cup max (after draining).  I added flour to the raspberries before mixing into the dough.

Line a sheet pan with parchment paper. Set aside.

In one bowl, grate the frozen butter. 

In another bowl, measure out the raspberries. Keep both in the freezer until ready to use. 

In a third bowl, measure out the heavy cream and keep it refrigerated until ready to use.

Combine the flour, grated butter, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl.

Make a well in the center of the bowl and pour in the cold cream. Gently stir with a rubber spatula until mostly combined, then use your hands to scoop up the dough and let it fall through your fingers, breaking up any large clumps. When almost combined but some flour pockets remain, add in the raspberries. Continue gently mixing until all of the dough is hydrated. 

Chill the bowl of dough in the fridge for 15 minutes.

Once rested, dump the dough onto a lightly floured surface and gently press the clumps together into an 8” round. Cut into 8 scones, then place each one onto the prepared baking sheet with a few inches of space in between each. Sprinkle the tops with the sparkling sugar, then chill the tray in the fridge while the oven preheats to 400°F.

Bake for 15-20 minutes, until the edges and corners of the scones start to turn golden brown.

Let the pan cool on a wire rack then enjoy!

Storage/Freezing: Let the scones cool completely, then store them in an airtight container at room temperature for 2-3 days. To absorb some of the extra moisture, I recommend placing a piece of white bread or a paper towel in the container. You can freeze the frozen unbaked scones in an airtight container or freezer bag for up to 3 months. They can be baked straight from the freezer!

recipeDescription:
Prep Time: Ready in 8 to 9 hours
Ken says he would eat this twice a month.
ingredientList:
8 pork chops
1/4 cup olive oil
1/4 teaspoon salt, to taste
1/4 teaspoon pepper, to taste
1 large onion, sliced 1/4-inch thick
2 cubes chicken bouillon
2 cups hot water
1 (8-ounce) package cream cheese
recipeText:
1. Season pork chops to taste.

2. Lightly brown pork chops in oil and place in crock-pot. Top pork chops with onion slices in the crock-pot.

3. Dissolve bouillon in hot water and pour over chops.

4. Cook on low 7 to 8 hours.

5. After the pork chops have cooked, stir cream cheese into the cooking juices. Turn crock-pot to high for about 30 minutes or until liquid is slightly thickened.

ingredientList:
1 16-ounce package frozen broccoli, cauliflower, and carrot mix
2 medium zucchini, halved lengthwise, sliced
1 packet Hidden Valley Ranch Dressing Mix (I use a little extra.)
2 tablespoons butter, melted
1/2 cup water
recipeText:
Place all veggies in a 4 qt slow cooker (crock pot).

Combine ranch mix, melted butter, and water, spoon over veggies and stir.

Cover and cook on LOW for 2 to 3 hours.

ingredientList:
4 boneless skinless chicken breast halves
8 small red potatoes, quartered (or use regular potatoes)
1 can condensed cream of chicken with herbs soup (10.5 oz)
1/4 cup water
1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
Dash salt
Dash pepper
Chopped fresh parsley
recipeText:
Place chicken and potatoes in a oven safe bowl.  

Mix soup, water, and garlic powder in a separate bowl.  Pour over chicken and potatoes. Cover.

Bake at 375 degrees for 30 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink and potatoes are done.  Garnish with parsley.  

Or, cook in slow cooker for 7 - 8 hours.

ingredientList:
3 medium potatoes, thinly sliced
2 large carrots, thinly sliced
1 onion, sliced
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon pepper
4 pounds beef rump roast
1/4 cup water
2 packages onion soup mix, dry
recipeText:
Put vegetables in the bottom of the crock-pot.  Salt and pepper meat, then put in pot.  

Sprinkle on onion soup mix.  Add liquid.  

Cover, cook on low 10 - 12 hours (high 5-6 hours).

ingredientList:
6 medium potatoes, peeled
8 ounces shredded Cheddar cheese
10 3/4 ounces cream of chicken soup
1/4 cup butter, melted
2 tablespoons water
8 ounces sour cream
3 ounces French's French Fried Onions
recipeText:
Cut potatoes in 1-inch strips.  Toss potatoes with a little salt and pepper plus 2 cups cheese.  Place in slow cooker.

Combine soup, melted butter and 2 TBSP water in a saucepan and heat just enough to pour over potato mixture.  

Cover and cook on LOW for 6 to 8 hours or until potatoes are tender.

Stir in sour cream and remaining cheese.

When ready to serve, sprinkle onion rings over top of potatoes.

ingredientList:
2 pounds new potatoes with peels, quartered
1/4 cup vegetable oil
1 packet Hidden Valley Ranch Dressing Mix
1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
1/4 cup water
recipeText:
Place potatoes, vegetable oil, dressing mix, and water in slow cooker and toss to coat potatoes.

Cover and cook on low for 3 - 4 hours or until potatoes are tender.

When ready to serve, sprinkle parsley over potatoes and toss.

recipeDescription: This can be made with canned biscuits for dumplings, or with egg noodles for noodle soup.
ingredientList:
6 cups water
1 Tbsp chicken bouillon paste (needs refrigeration after opening)
2 tablespoons butter
1 cup onion, diced
2 cloves garlic, minced (I usually leave this out)
1 cup celery, diced
1 cup carrot, diced
½ lb cooked chicken, shredded (I use canned chicken, drained)
2 cups egg noodles or 8 count roll of canned biscuits
1 teaspoon pepper
dried bay leaves - finely crushed
recipeText:
In a large pot, melt butter and add onions and garlic. Cook until onions have begun to soften. If you haven't cooked the chicken, cook it now (or use canned).

Add celery, carrots, and cooked shredded chicken.

Add water and add chicken bouillon to taste.

Add the egg noodles, salt, pepper, and bay leaves.

Bring to a boil and then reduce heat. If you are using biscuits, tear them in half, add to liquid, cover and simmer for 20 minutes.

Notes: You can used the granulated chicken bouillon, but the taste isn't as good and they are harder to dissolve.

ingredientList:
3-4 boneless skinless chicken breasts, cooked and diced
1 stalk celery, chopped
1/2 white onion, diced
2 teaspoons minced garlic
1/2 cup shredded carrots
1 tablespoon olive oil
2 cups low sodium chicken broth
salt and pepper, to taste
1 teaspoon thyme
16 ounces [[Gnocchi (Potato)|potato gnocchi]]
2 cups half-and-half, see note
1 cup fresh spinach, roughly chopped
recipeText:
Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add celery, onions, garlic, and carrots and saute for 2-3 minutes until onions are translucent.

Add chicken, chicken broth, salt, pepper, and thyme, bring to a boil, then gently stir in gnocchi. Boil for 3-4 minutes longer before reducing heat to a simmer and cooking for 10 minutes.

Stir in half and half and spinach and cook another 1-2 minutes until spinach is tender. Taste, add salt and pepper if needed, and serve.

Notes: For even more creamy richness, swap one cup of the half and half for heavy cream.

ingredientList:
1 can pinto beans
2 cans kidney beans
3 cans diced tomatoes
1 pound ground beef, cooked and drained
Chili powder, season to taste
Diced onion
Cheddar cheese
recipeText:
Mix all beans, tomatoes, and beef in large pot.  Add chili powder to your liking.  Heat the chili until boiling.  Stir as needed to prevent burning to bottom of pot.

Turn down heat and simmer until ready to eat.  Stir as needed.

Spoon into bowls and top with diced onions and cheddar cheese.

ingredientList:
2/3 cup sliced carrots
1/2 cup diced onions
2 teaspoons garlic salt (or 2 garlic cloves, minced)
1 16-ounce can diced tomatoes (with juice)
1/2 cup green beans
1/2 cup corn
1/2 teaspoon oregano
1/4 teaspoon salt
1 zucchini, sliced
recipeText:
Spray pan with nonstick cooking spray.  

Saute carrots, onion, and garlic over low heat until softened.  

Add broth, beans, corn, oregano, and salt.  Bring to boil. Lower heat,  (if using fresh green beans, simmer until beans are tender) then add zucchini.  Simmer until zucchini is tender.

ingredientList:
8 slices bacon, cut into small pieces
1 cup chopped onions
1 cup sour cream
1 can cream of chicken soup
Dash salt
Dash pepper
2 tablespoons parsley flakes
1 quart cubed potatoes
1/4 cup milk
recipeText:
Brown bacon and onions.  Drain fat and add to potatoes.  Cover with just enough water to cook until potatoes are tender.  

Add sour cream and chicken soup, and enough milk to achieve desired consistency.  Heat until hot, but do not boil.  Sprinkle with parsley flakes.  

Refrigerate overnight to achieve better flavor.

If you stick a bunch of basil leaves in the freezer without any preparation, those leaves are going to turn brown and mushy as soon as you pull them out. Basically, the freezer pauses the decomposition process, but then it fast forwards the minute those leaves feel warm air again.
It is possible to freeze basil leaves without them getting all nasty. It just takes a little prep work. 

You can blanch them, mix them with oil, or make basil pesto. Then you freeze. All of these methods are fast and easy. They require just 10 to 20 minutes of your time and a couple supplies.
Let's look at each of these methods.


Blanch Basil Leaves
The blanching process kills off the microorganisms that cause decomposition. It's the best way to ensure leaves from your garden retain both their nice green color and flavor after being frozen.

HOW TO BLANCH BASIL LEAVES
Fill a large bowl with ice water. Bring a large pot of water to boil.

Dip your basil stems into the boiling water for a few seconds. Your goal is not to cook the leaves (that'll get rid of some of the flavor)—just to wilt them.

Dunk the stems in the ice water immediately after to stop the cooking process.

Once your leaves are blanched, you just have to pat them dry with a towel and then strip them from the stems. Transfer the leaves to a freezer-safe bag (avoid bunching the leaves up in the bag) and place in the freezer.

Now you have frozen basil leaves ready to add to the very end of your cooking time when you're making pasta or pizza!


Preserve Basil in Olive Oil
Olive oil is a wonderful preservative because it prevents the growth of those microorganisms that cause decay. To preserve your basil leaves in olive oil, you just need a high-quality olive oil (I recommend extra virgin olive oil) and an ice cube tray.

HOW TO MAKE FROZEN BASIL CUBES
I recommend blanching the basil leaves first, but it's optional. Make sure to at least wash your leaves and then pat them dry with a kitchen towel.

Strip the leaves from the stems. My trick is to hold the top part of a stem and rub my hands downward. This method works for herbs like basil, thyme, and oregano, and the thicker the stem, the easier it is to pull those leaves off quickly.

Chop the basil leaves into small pieces. Cutting releases the oils and the flavor and also makes it easier to save your herbs. Your pieces don't need to be precise. Saving the flavor of summer is what matters here, not making it look pretty.

Stuff as much basil as you can into each little cube.

Fill each cube to the top with olive oil (or at least make sure all the leaves are covered so they'll freeze). Again, the goal is not to look pretty. The goal is flavor, and that you shall have.

Stick your tray in the freezer.

Once the cubes are frozen, pop them out and store them in a freezer-safe baggie, Tupperware, or jar.

Whenever you're craving basil, all you have to do is open your freezer, pull out a cube, and toss it in a pan to melt on the stove. Boom! You'll be transported to summer, and your dish will taste so fresh and gourmet.
Toss you basil cubes on pasta, grilled or baked chicken, tomato soup—any cooked dish that calls for basil. Your kitchen will smell like you're in the middle of July, even though it's January.

TIP:
This method also works well with other soft herbs like cilantro, parsley, dill, and even chives.


Freeze Basil Pesto
Pesto freezes really well thanks to the olive oil inside. If you have a couple basil plants, you can easily make enough pesto to last you all winter long.

HOW TO FREEZE BASIL PESTO
Blanch your basil leaves to preserve the green color. Otherwise, wash your leaves and pat them dry.

Use a food processor to whip up your favorite pesto recipe. I toss about 3 cups basil leaves in with roasted pine nuts or almonds, a couple garlic cloves, grated parmesan cheese, olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Blitz the ingredients in a food processor until you have a spreadable paste.

Spread your pesto into an ice cube tray (or a nonstick muffin pan, if you'd like larger servings).

Stick your tray in the freezer.

Once the pesto cubes are frozen, pop them out and store them in a freezer-safe baggie, Tupperware, or jar.

Pull a cube out and melt it over warm pasta for a cozy meal on a cold night. If you're feeling adventurous, add your pesto to pizza, grilled vegetables, or even egg-based dishes for breakfast.

ingredientList:
2 cups fresh basil leaves
2 tablespoons pine nuts or walnuts
2 cloves garlic
1/2 cup extra virgin olive oil
1/2 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese
recipeText:
Combine basil leaves, pine nuts or walnuts and garlic in a food processor and process until very finely minced.

With the machine running slowly dribble in the oil and process until the mixture is smooth.

Add the cheese and process very briefly, just long enough to combine. Store in refrigerator or freezer.

recipeDescription:
This recipe is from Tupperware. It's really good for chicken nachos.
Adds delicious spice to chicken, fish, pork, and veggies.
ingredientList:
2 1/2 tablespoons smoked paprika
9 tablespoons ground cumin
1 1/2 tablespoons garlic powder
2 1/2 tablespoons chipotle or chili powder
2 1/2 tablespoons dried cilantro
5 tablespoons onion powder
2 1/2 tablespoons sugar
4 tablespoons kosher salt
recipeText:
Combine ingredients in Dry Storage Containers seal, and shake to combine. Store up to 6 months. Shake before using.

Store up to 6 months. Adds delicious spice to chicken fish pork and veggies. Also makes a fun gift for the holidays.

recipeDescription:
Melissa loved these, Ken thought they were okay.
He likes Greek seasoning best.
ingredientList:
1 tablespoon dry ranch mix
1 pound brussels sprouts
3 slices bacon
1/2 small red onion
2 tablespoons oil
recipeText:
Preheat oven to 400°

Wash, dry and cut off bottoms of sprouts and then slice in half.

Slice the onion into very thin slices.

Dice the bacon.

Add the sprouts, onion, bacon, ranch seasoning and oil to a ziploc bag and shake until everything is mixed and coated.

Place everything on a foil lined baking sheet in an even layer.

Bake 20-25 minutes until sprouts are tender and roasted and bacon is crispy.

Notes:
Add red pepper flakes for spice.
You can leave out the onion if you dont like it or substitute for garlic.

recipeDescription: This are really good. Supposed to be an appetizer, but we eat them as a meal.
ingredientList:
1 pound brussels sprouts
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon pepper
1 pound bacon
1/2 cup brown sugar
recipeText:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F and line a baking sheet with foil.

2. Cut the ends off of the brussel sprouts and season them with salt and pepper.

3. Cut the bacon in half. Wrap each brussel sprout with a piece of the bacon and secure it to the brussel sprout with a toothpick.

4. Dip each one in the brown sugar to coat the bacon in the brown sugar. Then place them on the baking sheet.

5. Bake for 30-35 minutes, flipping them halfway through the cook time, until the bacon is crispy and the brussel sprouts are tender.

6. Remove them from the baking sheet, remove the toothpicks, serve warm and enjoy!

An alternative is to mix maple sugar with the brown sugar before baking.

These are best served fresh but you can refrigerate the leftovers in an airtight container for up to 5 days.

ingredientList:
2 slices thick-cut bacon, cut into 1" pieces
2 cloves garlic, smashed
1 pound brussels sprouts, trimmed and halved
1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, plus more for serving
1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika, plus more for serving
1/2 teaspoon black pepper, plus more for serving
1/4 cup brown sugar
1 teaspoon bourbon whiskey
recipeText:
1. In a large skillet over medium heat, cook bacon until crispy, 5 to 6 minutes. 
Transfer bacon to a plate using a slotted spoon. 
Pour off all but 4 tablespoons bacon fat from the skillet.

2. Return skillet to medium heat. Add garlic and Brussels sprouts cut-side down. Let cook, undisturbed, until bottoms are golden and edges are crispy, 5 to 6 minutes. 
Add salt, paprika, and pepper, and continue to cook, stirring occasionally, until sprouts are golden all over and tender, 4 to 5 minutes more.

3. Stir in sweetener and bourbon and cook until thick and syrupy, 2 to 3 minutes. 
Return bacon to skillet and toss to coat.

4. Sprinkle with more salt, paprika, and pepper to taste, if desired, and serve.

recipeDescription: This is a simple way to make brussel sprouts taste good. Ken likes them best of all I've made.
ingredientList:
brussels sprouts
Cavender's brand Greek Seasoning
olive oil
recipeText:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F and line a baking sheet with foil.

Clean brussel sprouts and cut in half. Remove any brown or yellow leaves.
Place brussel sprouts in a bowl and drizzle with olive oil, lighly coating all sprouts.
Shake desired amount of Greek seasoning over sprouts.
Place them on the baking sheet.

Bake for 30-35 minutes, flipping them halfway through the cook time, until sprouts are tender.
Do not overcook or they will get a bitter taste.

Remove them from the baking sheet, serve warm and enjoy!

Notes:
-To speed up cooking time and and help prevent bitterness, parboil them in salted water for 2 minutes (max) before adding oil and seasoning.
-These are best served fresh but you can refrigerate the leftovers in an airtight container for up to 5 days.

recipeDescription: This is a really good recipe and easy to make.  Tastes good reheated.
ingredientList:
5 slices bacon
3 tablespoons butter
2 small shallots, minced
2 pounds brussels sprouts, halved
kosher salt
1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper
3/4 cup heavy cream
1/2 cup shredded sharp white Cheddar cheese
1/2 cup shredded gruyére cheese
recipeText:
Preheat oven to 375°. In a large oven-safe skillet over medium heat, cook bacon until crispy, 8 minutes. 
Drain on a paper towel-lined plate, then chop. Discard bacon fat. 

Return skillet to medium heat and melt butter. Add shallots and Brussels sprouts and season with salt and cayenne. 
Cook, stirring occasionally, until tender, about 10 minutes. 

Remove from heat and drizzle with heavy cream, then top with both cheeses and bacon. 

Bake until cheese is bubbly, 12 to 15 minutes. (If your cheese isn't golden, switch oven to broil and broil 1 minute.)

recipeDescription: Melissa loved these peas growing up!
ingredientList:
Land-o-Lakes American Cheese (can be found at Walmart deli counter)
Milk
flour
Peas
recipeText:
The Land-o-Lakes cheese in important!  I guess other American cheeses would work, but this one is the best.

Melt cheese and add milk until cheese is a faint yellow.  If the cheese is too runny, add a bit of flour to thicken it. 

Heat peas.  Pour cheese mixture over the peas.

This is good on it's own or served over mashed potatoes.

ingredientList:
Cucumber
Onion
Tomato
1/4 cup apple cider vinegar
3 tablespoons grapeseed oil or avocado oil
2-3 tablespoons sugar
Salt
Pepper
recipeText:
Mix vinegar, oil, and sugar.  Cut cucumber, onion, and tomato put into mixture.  Sprinkle with salt and pepper. 

Let sit for a couple hours to absorb flavor.

ingredientList: Zucchini
recipeText:
Grated: If you would like to have grated zucchini ready to go for your favorite recipes in your freezer this is a method to use.

Grate the required amount for a specific recipe then steam it by placing it in a sieve or colander 1 inch deep. Steam it over water for 5 minutes. Steam the zucchini 3 inches above the boiling water and have a lid on the kettle. Cool the zucchini before putting it in a container for freezing. Label the package with the amount you started with.

Slices: To freeze wash and cut zucchini in 1/2 inch slices. Place in boiling water for 3 minutes. Start timing immediately, do not wait for the boil to return. Cool in cold water. Drain and freeze. If you wish to fry it in slices, freeze on cookie sheet and then package frozen. Dip slices in mixture and crumbs or flour before it thaws. For casseroles, freeze cubes or small slices of zucchini.Recipe formatted with the Cook'n Grocery List Software from DVO Enterprises.

ingredientList:
1 pound baby carrots
2 tablespoons butter
3 teaspoons minced garlic
recipeText:
Steam or microwave carrots until just tender.

Melt butter, mix in garlic.  Pour over carrots and mix.  Heat thoroughly.  Sprinkle with finely chopped herbs as desired.

recipeDescription: Melissa thought it was good/different. Ken just thought it was okay.
ingredientList:
3 zucchini
3 tablespoons butter, softened
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley
1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese
recipeText:
1. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat, and lightly oil the grate.

2. Cut the zucchini in half crosswise, then slice each half into 3 slices lengthwise, making 6 slices per zucchini.

3. Mix the butter, garlic, and parsley in a bowl, and spread the mixture on both sides of each zucchini slice. Sprinkle one side of each slice with Parmesan cheese, and place the slices, cheese sides up, crosswise on the preheated grill to keep them from falling through.

4. Grill the zucchini until the cheese has melted and the slices are cooked through and show grill marks, about 8 minutes.

This can also be done on the broiler.

ingredientList:
3/4 cup milk
1/8 teaspoon pepper
1 10 3/4-ounce can cream of mushroom soup
28 ounces cut green beans, drained
1 1/3 cups French's French Fried Onions
recipeText:
In a 1 1/2 quart casserole dish, mix all ingredients except 2/3 cup onions.  

Bake 350 degrees for 30 minutes, or until hot.  Stir.  Top with remaining onions.

ingredientList:
2 large, firm, ripe tomatoes
3 tablespoons fine, dry bread crumbs
2 tablespoons minced fresh basil
1 tablespoon minced fresh parsley
1 clove garlic, minced
1 teaspoon olive oil
Vegetable cooking spray
recipeText:
Cut tomatoes in half horizontally, scoop out seeds with the tip of a spoon.  Leave pulp in tack, discard seeds.  Set tomato halves aside.

Combine breadcrumbs, basil, parsley, and garlic.  Spoon breadcrumb mixture evenly into tomato halves.  Drizzle with oil.  

Coat grill rack with cooking spray, place on grill over medium-hot coals (350 - 400 degrees, broil 6 minutes).  

Tear off a 12-inch square piece of aluminum foil; poke holes in foil with wooden pick.  Place foil on grill; arrange tomato halves on foil.  Grill, covered, 15 minutes or until tomato halves are tender.

ingredientList:
1 16-ounce package frozen broccoli, cauliflower, and carrot mix
2 medium zucchini, halved lengthwise, sliced
1 packet Hidden Valley Ranch Dressing Mix (I use a little extra, about 4 tablespoons.)
2 tablespoons butter, melted
1/2 cup water
recipeText:
Place all veggies in a 4 qt slow cooker (crock pot).

Combine ranch mix, melted butter, and water, spoon over veggies and stir.

Cover and cook on LOW for 2 to 3 hours.

ingredientList:
1 pound baby carrots
2 tablespoons butter
2 teaspoons honey
recipeText:
Steam or microwave carrots until just tender.

Melt butter and mix with honey.  Pour over carrots and mix.  Heat thoroughly.  Sprinkle with finely chopped chives or parsley as desired.

ingredientList:
1 pound broccoli
Dash pepper
Dash parmesan cheese
recipeText:
Steam Broccoli for approximately 5 - 6 minutes or until just tender.

Sprinkle with pepper and parmesan cheese.

Serve.

ingredientList:
1/4 cup butter
1/2 cup bread crumbs
1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese
1 teaspoon salt
1/8 teaspoon pepper
3 large tomatoes, peeled and cut into 1-inch thick slices
recipeText:
Melt butter; put half into a small bowl and stir in bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper. Brush tomato slices with remaining butter; dip in crumb and cheese mixture. 

Arrange on broiler rack covered with greased aluminum foil. 

Broil 5 to 6 inches below heat until lightly browned. Turn with a spatula and brown the other side.

recipeDescription: These are good and pretty easy to make. There was too much parmesan. We want to try this with something more like chicken breading.
ingredientList:
1/2 cup finely grated Parmesan cheese
1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil
1 tablespoon unsalted butter, melted
1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
1/2 teaspoon onion powder
1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper
1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper
1 pound brussels sprouts, trimmed and halved
1 teaspoon grated lemon zest
recipeText:
Preheat oven to 425°F.

Stir Parmesan, oil, butter, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, pepper and crushed red pepper together in a small bowl.

Spread in a thin layer in the center of a nonstick baking sheet.

Press Brussels sprouts, cut-sides down, into the Parmesan mixture in a single even layer about 3/4- to 1-inch apart.

Bake until the Brussels sprouts are tender and the Parmesan layer is golden-brown and crisp, 16 to 18 minutes.

Remove from oven and let stand for 5 minutes. (The Parmesan will further crisp once removed from the oven.)

Sprinkle with lemon zest and serve hot.

recipeDescription: Many different veggies are made better by roasting. Our favorite seasonings are Cavender’s Greek Seasoning, Tony Chachere’s Creole Seasoning, and a mix of garlic powder (or garlic), salt, & black pepper.
ingredientList:
Bell Peppers. Packed with vitamins (like potassium and iron) and antioxidants.

Zucchini. Zucchini has a mild flavor, but roasting it elevates its natural goodness.

Sweet Potato. Rich in vitamins and potassium.

Red, Yellow or Sweet Onion.

Broccoli. Broccoli is packed with fiber, vitamin A, and vitamin C.

Cauliflower.

Brussels Sprouts.

Vegetable, Canola, or Olive Oil

Seasonings – see below.
recipeText:
ROASTING THE VEGETABLES

• Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.

• If needed, coat baking sheet with non-stick spray. If using a good pan, this is not necessary.

• Place cut vegetables in a great big bowl or zip-top bag.

• Top with oil and sprinkle with seasoning. Toss to coat.

• Pay special attention to the broccoli florets and make sure they get an adequate amount of oil, as they are more prone to burning.

• Spread the vegetables into a single layer with a bit of space. Divide the vegetables evenly between two sheets if needed.

• Roast the vegetables at 400 degrees F. for 25 minutes.

• Toss the vegetables halfway through.

• Enjoy hot or at room temperature, with additional salt and pepper to taste.


SEASONINGS
• Cavender’s Greek Seasoning
• Tony Chachere’s Creole Seasoning
• Garlic - salt, pepper, and garlic powder (or minced garlic).
• Italian Seasoning
• Rosemary
• Dijon Mustard
• Parmesan. A finishing sprinkle of Parmesan cheese.
• Spicy - Season with 1/2 teaspoon chipotle chile powder (more if you like super spicy!), or regular chili powder plus cayenne.
• Cheesy - Sprinkle with freshly grated cheddar, mozzarella, gruyere, or Parmesan cheese. Add after roasting. Pop back into the oven for a few minutes to melt.
• Citrus - Add thin lemon slices or orange slices to the pan. Finish with a squeeze of fresh lemon juice or orange juice.
• Pesto - Reduce the olive oil. Toss the vegetables in store-bought or homemade pesto.
• Honey - 1 tablespoon honey and an extra pinch of salt. Line your baking sheet with foil or parchment paper for easy clean up.
• Curry - Season with curry powder and a touch of cumin.
• Balsamic - 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar prior to roasting. Line the pan with foil or parchment paper for easy clean up.
• Mediterranean - Season with oregano and a touch of red wine vinegar. Add sliced olives to the pan. Sprinkle with feta cheese and top with a squeeze of lemon juice prior to serving.

CUTTING VEGETABLES FOR ROASTING
If you are mixing different vegetables on the pan, you will want to make sure they finish cooking in the same amount of time. Here are some tips:

• Round Root Vegetables (Beets, Sweet Potatoes, Potatoes). Cut these vegetables on the smaller size (about 3/4-inch pieces), as they tend to take longer to roast.

• Long Root Vegetables (Carrots, Parsnips). Similarly, these veggies take longer to roast. Cut any thick ones in half lengthwise, then cut them crosswise into 1 1/2-inch slices.

• Cruciferous Vegetables (Brussels Sprouts, Cauliflower, Broccoli). Cut Brussels sprouts in half, and remove the stems. Cut broccoli and cauliflower stems into small rectangular pieces, and slice florets into pieces that are about 1/2- to 3/4-inch thick and 1 1/2- to 2-inches wide.

• Soft Vegetables (Green Beans, Asparagus). These veggies roast quickly, so you can leave them as is (discard the ends of the green beans and woody stems of the asparagus)

• Bell Peppers (Green, Red, Yellow, Orange). Core the peppers and cut into 3/4-inch pieces or 1/2-inch strips.

• Onions (Red, Yellow, or Sweet). Cut off the stem end, then remove the paper and waxy layers. Cut off the root end, then slice the onion in half from end to end. Cut each half lengthwise into about 4 wedges.

• Cherry Tomatoes (or Grape Tomatoes). Leave whole. Line your baking sheet with parchment paper, as the yummy juices will become sticky and caramelize.

TO STORE: Refrigerate leftovers in an airtight storage container for up to 5 days.
TO REHEAT: Rewarm vegetables on a baking sheet in the oven at 350 degrees F or in the microwave.
TO FREEZE: Freeze leftovers in an airtight freezer-safe storage container for up to 3 months. Reheat from frozen. Once reheated, frozen roasted vegetables may be a bit soggy, but they will still have great flavor.

ingredientList:
1/2 onion
1 jalapeno pepper (with seeds) or serrano pepper
2 cloves garlic
1/2 tablespoon cilantro
6 roma tomatoes
1 teaspoon salt
recipeText: Process all ingredients in food processor.  Chill before use.

ingredientList:
Spaghetti Squash
1 spaghetti squash
1 jar hot marinara sauce
recipeText:
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.

Split the squashes in half and scrape out seeds. Place in glass baking dish with 1 inch of water.   Place flesh side down and roast for 30 to 40 minutes until fully cooked. Remove from the oven and let rest until cool enough to handle.


When squash is cool enough to handle, using a large kitchen spoon scrape the strands of squash from the inside of the skin. Toss the spaghetti squash in the pan with the hot marinara for just long enough to get hot. Serve and enjoy.

recipeDescription:
Tastes like lasagna, but uses squash instead of pasta.  Yum!!!
Ken would eat this twice a month.
ingredientList:
1 pound ground beef
1 small onion, chopped
2 teaspoons minced garlic
1 jar spaghetti sauce
4 medium summer squash  (or zucchini)
1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
1/4 cup parmesan cheese
recipeText:
Cook ground beef, onion, and garlic in a frying pan.  Mix in spaghetti sauce.

In an 9x11 glass pan, put a layer of 1/2 the hamburger mixture.

Slice squash into 1/4 inch slices.  Cut in half if large.  Put a layer of squash over hamburger.

Next put a layer of 1/2 cup each of mozzarella and cheddar cheese.

Put another layer of squash. Then the rest of the cheese.

Cover with remaining hamburger mixture.

Baked covered with foil for at 425 degrees for 40 - 45 minutes or until squash is tender.

Remove from oven and sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Squash will release liquid while baking.  If you don't like it as wet, cook the squash for a short period before putting into the pan, or remove the foil after 25 - 30 minutes.

ingredientList:
2 cups tomatoes
1 cucumber
1/2 cup onions
1/2 cup vinegar
1/8 cup olive oil
1 teaspoon Italian seasoning
1 teaspoon oregano
Dash salt
Dash pepper
1/2 teaspoon minced garlic
recipeText: Cut tomatoes and cucumbers into bite size slices.  Mix all ingredients together.  Refrigerate until use.

ingredientList:
3 tablespoons butter
1 cup long-grain white rice
1 teaspoon fresh minced garlic
1 teaspoon onion powder or dried minced onion
1 teaspoon ground turmeric
2 cups chicken broth
Ground black pepper to taste
recipeText:
Heat butter in a large saucepan over medium heat.

Add the rice and gently stir until rice begins to lightly brown.

Add garlic, onion powder, and turmeric and stir until well mixed in.

Slowly stir in chicken broth and raise heat to medium-high. Add salt and pepper to taste.

Bring the mix to a boil then turn the heat to low and cover the pan with a lid.

Simmer for 20 to 25 minutes. Remove from heat and fluff with a fork. Serves 4.

ingredientList:
4 large zucchini
1/4 teaspoon salt
Vegetable cooking spray
1 teaspoon olive oil
1 cup finely chopped onions
3 cloves garlic, minced
1/2 cup finely chopped tomatoes
1/3 cup fine, dry bread crumbs
1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
3 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese
1/2 teaspoon pepper
recipeText:
Cut zucchini in half lengthwise; scoop out pulp, leaving 1/2-inch thick shells.  Sprinkle shells with salt; set aside.  Coarsely chop pulp.

Coat a medium nonstick skillet with cooking spray, and add oil; place over medium-high heat until hot.   

Add chopped zucchini and onion; cook 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally.  

Add garlic and tomato; cook 2 minutes or until thickened, stirring occasionally.  Remove from heat; stir in breadcrumbs and remaining 4 ingredients.

Spoon vegetable mixture evenly into zucchini shells.  Place a 13x9x2-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray.  Cover and bake 375 degrees for 20 minutes. 

Uncover and bake 20 additional minutes or until zucchini shells are fork-tender and stuffing is lightly browned.

ingredientList:
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 large onion, diced
2 teaspoons minced garlic
2 large zucchini, thinly sliced
16 ounces spaghetti sauce
1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
1/8 cup parmesan cheese
recipeText:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees.

In a large pot boil the zucchini until tender; drain.  Meanwhile, in a medium frying pan heat the olive oil over medium heat and saute the onion and garlic until the onion is tender.

Combine the zucchini, onion and garlic in a 9x12 inch casserole dish, and mix well. Pour the spaghetti sauce over the mixture and stir well. Top with mozzarella cheese (use more or less depending on your preference).

Bake in preheated oven for about 20 minutes, or until heated through and cheese is bubbly. 

Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

recipeDescription: Quick vegetable saute that's very versatile! You can use any veggies you like. Serve over pasta, if desired.
ingredientList:
1 tablespoon olive oil
1/2 red onion, diced
1 dash salt
1 dash pepper
4 zucchini, halved and sliced
1/2 pound fresh mushrooms, sliced
1 tomato, diced
1 clove garlic, minced
1 teaspoon Italian seasoning
recipeText:
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute onion with salt and pepper for 2 minutes. 

Stir in zucchini and mushrooms. When zucchini begins to soften, add tomatoes, garlic and Italian seasoning. Cook until heated through.

ingredientList:
8 ounces cream cheese
1/2 cup brown sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
recipeText: Mix. Serve with apples.

ingredientList:
1 cup mayonnaise
2 cups sour cream
2 cups shredded Parmesan cheese
1/4 cup diced onions
1 can or jar artichoke hearts
garlic
recipeText: Chop artichoke and mix well and microwave until hot.

ingredientList:
1/4 cup packed brown sugar
soy sauce
water chestnut 
bacon
recipeText:
Mix brown sugar with enough soy sauce to liquify.

Roll a whole water chestnut in bacon ( hold with toothpicks)

Marinate the bacon wrapped chestnut in the brown sugar mixture for 3 hours or overnight.

Broil Or microwave until bacon is done.


(I put mine in a flat baking dish in the oven, then put them in a crock pot)

This Recipe is probably for one can of water chestnuts, so if you want more, need to double the recipe.

ingredientList:
1 (16-ounce) carton sour cream
1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese
1/4 cup real bacon bits
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients. Cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving.

Jazz it up with a touch of ranch dressing.

ingredientList:
1 pound bacon Cut in thirds
1 pound little smokies small sausages
1 stick butter
2 cups brown sugar
recipeText:
How to make Bacon Wrapped Smokies with Brown Sugar add butter

Preheat oven 375 degrees.

Cut bacon into thirds and wrap each smokie in a slice of bacon.

Place the wrapped smokies in a single layer in a baking dish.

Melt stick of butter and mix with 1 cup Brown Sugar. Stir until mixed well.

Pour the butter and brown sugar mixture on the smokies and bacon.

Sprinkle the remaining 1 cup of brown sugar evenly over the smokies.

Bake for about 18 -20 minutes at 375 degrees. 

Then turn the heat up to 400 degrees and bake for about 5 minutes until the bacon becomes crispy.

ingredientList:
1 cup brown sugar
2 cups ketchup
1 1/2 bags SIMICK meat balls
1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce

1 cup mayonnaise
1 cup sour cream
1 pound crispy bacon, crumbled
4 Roma tomatoes, diced
1 teaspoon Lawry seasoning salt
recipeText:
Mix all together.
Serve with Fritos.

ingredientList:
8 ounces crescent roll dough
1 pound smokies
1/2 cup butter melted		
1/2 cup pecans chopped			
3 tablespoons honey
3 tablespoons brown sugar
recipeText:
Unroll crescent rolls and cut in 1/2" wide strips. Roll the sausage in each and put seam down in a 9x13 pan. 
Combine other ingredients and pour over sausages. Bake at 450 for 15 minutes. Do not over-bake.

ingredientList:
1 cup butter
1/2 cup light Karo syrup 
2 cups Brown sugar 
1  17-oz box Corn Chex 
1  bag Fritos corn chips 
1  16-oz  can mixed nuts
recipeText:
Boil butter, brown sugars, and Karo Syrup for 1 1/2 Minutes Stirring constantly.  Pour cereal mixture over the mix to coat. 

Bake 350 degrees for 8 minutes. 

Stir and bake for another 8 minutes. 

Spread out on waved paper and break apart when cooled.

ingredientList:
2  8-ounce packages cream cheese
1  8-ounce can crushed pineapple tidbits
1 cup chopped pecans or walnuts
chopped onion
garlic salt
seasoned salt
Dash of Worcestershire sauce
recipeText: Mix together and lay pecans or walnuts on a piece of saran wrap. Put mixture in middle of nuts and roll saran wrap round and chill.

ingredientList:
1 teaspoon paprika
8 slices bacon, cooked
1 1/2  8-oz blocks of cream cheese, softened
1 cup shredded cheese
1 teaspoon garlic powder
kosher salt, dash
freshly ground pepper
1/3 cup chopped chives
1/3 cup parsley finally chopped 
pecans
recipeText:
Crumble cooked bacon into small pieces.    
Mix softened cream cheese, bacon, cheese, garlic powder, salt, pepper, chives, paprika.
Roll into small balls.  
Roll balls in pecans to coat, put pretzel stick in each ball, refrigerate. 
If you not use right away put plastic wrap over and return to refrigerator.

ingredientList:
1 egg beaten
1 pound ground beef
1 cup cracker or dry bread crumbs
1 small onion chopped
1 teaspoon parsley flakes
1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
sauce
2 cups catsup
1 cup brown sugar
1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
recipeText:
Combine first 9 ingredients, shape into 1" balls. Bake at 350 for 10 to 15 minutes. Combine catsup, brown sugar and Worcestershire sauce. 
Cook until hot and blended. Add meatballs and heat through. Serve with toothpicks.

ingredientList:
2 pounds ground beef
1 envelope onion soup mix
1 egg
2 tsp Accent
1/4 cup bread or cracker crumbs
2 tsp butter
1/4 cup apple Jelly
1 (14) oz ketchup
1/2 tsp ground oregano
recipeText:
Heat slightly age ketchup. Jelly and oregano. Set aside. Combine the other ingredients and mix well.

Form small balls the side of filberts and fry or bake in Oven Mix balls in sauce and Bake 20 minutes

or make ahead of time and preheat at time of serving.. Eat on toothpick.

ingredientList:
2.250 ounces jar dried beef
8 ounces cream cheese
3 tablespoons sour cream
crackers or snack toast of your choice
recipeText:
In a mixing bowl, combine cream cheese and sour cream until you get a smooth creamy mixture. 

Next rinse the dried beef under warm water and chop the meat into small pieces. 

Stir the dried beef in to the creamy mixture and place in a small baking dish. 

Bake for 25 minutes at 300 degrees a until golden color appears on the top. 

Serve with your favorite cracker or snack toast.

ingredientList:
6 eggs
2 teaspoons mayonnaise marlene uses mericale whip
1 teaspoon vinegar
1/2 teaspoon salt
dash of pepper
1/2 teaspoon dry mustard or 1 teaspoon prepared mustard
1/4 teaspoon paprika
recipeText:
I mix the above ingredients with the yolks in a small baggie. Mix well, cut off the corner of the bag, and squeeze into the white part of the egg.

(I got this tip from Jan Aakre and have used for years)

ingredientList:
1 tube sugar cookie dough (homemade or store bought)
8 ounces cream cheese
1/3 cup sugar
1 cup pineapple tidbits
2 kiwi fruits, peeled and sliced
1 cup strawberries, sliced
1 cup blueberries
recipeText:
Spread sugar cookie dough on pizza pan.  Bake as directed.  Cool crust to room temperature.  

Mix cream cheese with sugar to taste as you wish.  

Right before serving, spread cream cheese mixture over cookie dough crust.  

Top with fruit of your choice.   

For fancy snacks, use small sugar cookies instead of making sugar cookie crust on pizza pan.

ingredientList:
1 (10 3/4-ounce) can cream of mushroom soup
1 (10 3/4-ounce) can cream of chicken soup
3 pounds ground beef
1 pound Mexican cheese
recipeText: Brown hamburger, drain grease. Mix in soups and cheese until cheese is melted and ingredients are hot.

recipeName: Imitation Crab Spread - Annie Radimaker @ Biebl-Ranweiler
ingredientList:
1 pound imitation crab meat
1 small onion (you can use purple onions)
1 bottle (small Kraft) ranch salad dressing
1/2 jar Kraft mayonnaise
2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese
2 cups shredded Swiss cheese
recipeText: Mix and eat!

recipeName: Meatballs  - Judy Lexvold and Leann Flugge
recipeDescription: Good appetizer meatballs. From Judy Lexvold and Leann Flugge.
ingredientList:
Meat:
2 pounds hamburger
4 eggs
2 cups saltine crackers
1/2 cup onions Save 3 Tablespoon for sauce

Sauce:
1 1/2 cups ketchup
1 cup water
1/2 cup vinegar
2/3 cup brown sugar
8 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce
2 teaspoons dry mustard
recipeText:
Mix all meat ingredients together and shape into balls.

Put on cookie sheets.

Bake meatballs at 325 degrees for 30 minutes.

Put meatballs into a casserole dish.

Mix all sauce ingredients together. Pour sauce over meatballs.

Bake meatballs in sauce for 1 hour.

ingredientList:
6 ounces softened cream cheese
1/2 cup mayonnaise
1/2 cup finely chopped pecans
1 cup chopped salad olives
dash pepper no salt
recipeText: Mix ingredients together in bowl and refrigerate for 24 hours before using. Spread on crackers.

recipeName: Pickles corn beef spread  with crackers
ingredientList:
1 8 oz cream cheese
1 Buddy's Corn Beef
pickles chopped
recipeText: mix

ingredientList:
1 stick butter
1 package ranch salad dressing mix
1/4 cup Grated Parmesan cheese
1 tablespoon red pepper flakes
1 teaspoon garlic powder
1 box Ritz crackers
recipeText: Toss Box of crackers with all ingredients

ingredientList:
1 cup real mayonnaise
1 cup sour cream
2 teaspoons Beau-mandi Seasoning
2 teaspoons dill weed
1 tablespoon dehydrated onions flakes
2 teaspoons parsley flakes
Salt and Pepper
recipeText: Mix

ingredientList:
16 oz corned beef chopped
1 can sauerkraut Drained
1 cup sour cream
2 cups mozzarella cheese
1- 8 oz cream cheese
recipeText: Melt in crock pot; serve with Crackers.

ingredientList:
1 can 2 1/2 sauerkraut
1/2 pound ham ground
1 beaten egg
flour
Cracker Crumbs
recipeText:
Bring sauerkraut to a boil.  Drain & cool. Add ground ham and pepper.

Form into small balls while you squeeze out all the juice.

Roll in flour, then in egg.

Roll in fine cracker crumbs and deep fry.

Makes 80 to 90 balls.

recipeDescription: This recipe will fill a big crockpot. Far smaller groups, I make half the recipe and use a 1 quart crockpot.
ingredientList:
2 cups 16 oz cream cheese
2 cups sour cream
2 cups shredded Swiss cheese
2 packages ( 2 -5oz each) corned beef Chopped
16 can sauerkraut ( undrained )
recipeText: Heat everything in a crockpot and serve warm with wheat crackers or Frito chips (Dipping style)

ingredientList:
2 pounds Jimmy Dean Sage Sausage, browned
2 packages cream cheese Softened
1 cup diced Petite tomatoes 14-oz can
recipeText:
Combine all ingredients, top with shredded mozzarella cheese.

Can bake in oven to brown.

ingredientList:
8 ounces cream cheese
1/4 Salasa
1-8 ounces pkg imitation crab meat chopped
1/4 cup chopped black olives
1/4 cup green olives
1 pkg flour tortillas
recipeText:
Beat cream cheese until smooth add rest of the ingredients, except tortillas
spread on Tortillas
Roll up
wrap in vlasic
refrigerate overnight
cut into bite size pieces
Keep refrigerated

ingredientList:
2 packages 8 OZ cream cheese
1/2 cup milk
1 jar mild cocktail SAUCE
1 can broken shrimp
1 can crabmeat
recipeText:
Garlic, salt, Parmesan cheese, Crackers
Blend cheese and milk, spread in shallow dish, spread on cocktail cause next.
cover with shrimp and crabmeat with garlic, salt, and Parmesan cheese

Use as a dip for wheat thin etc.

ingredientList:
Snow peas
Sea salt
Sesame seed oil
Sesame seeds
recipeText: Toast seeds in frying pan w/o oil

ingredientList:
1 can cream of mushroom soup
1 can cream of chicken soup
3 pounds hamburger cooked
1 pound Mexican-blend cheese
recipeText:
Melt all and add meat. 
Serve with chips.

ingredientList:
1 pound hamburger
1 envelope taco seasoning mix
1 Small Jar Salsa
8 oz cream cheese
flour tortilla
recipeText:
Brown Hamburger, add taco seasoning as directed on package. Cool.
Add cream cheese and slash blend with mixer.
Spread on tortillas.
Roll up and wrap in plastic.
Refrigerate overnight. Cut in bite size pieces.
Refrigerate leftovers.

ingredientList:
2 big ripe avocados, peeled and seed removed
8-ounce package cream cheese
8 ounces sour cream
Pinch garlic salt
1 1/2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese
1 1/2 cups diced tomatoes
1 1/2 cups shredded lettuce
Optional picante sauce
recipeText:
Mash and mix the avocados, cream cheese, sour cream, and garlic salt until creamy. Spread on a pizza pan.

Top with shredded cheese, diced tomatoes, shredded lettuce, and picante sauce.

ingredientList:
12 flour tortillas
8 ounces cream cheese softened
1 cup sour cream
1 (4-ounce) can chopped green onions
2 teaspoons chopped red bell peppers
12 ounces shredded sharp cheddar cheese
1 package imitation crab meat chopped
recipeText:
In a medium bowl combine cream cheese, sour cream, chilies, onion, red pepper and cheddar cheese

Mix thoroughly. Spread onto tortillas and toll up. cover tightly and chill for 2 hours or overnight
when ready to serve, cut each roll into 1/2 inch slices

Makes about 8 dozen roll-ups.

ingredientList:
4 cups M&M'S
4 cups Peanuts or mixed nuts
2 cups Raisins
Pretzels are optional
recipeText: Mix together in large bowl and serve.

ingredientList:
1 1/4 cups mayonnaise
1 cup cottage cheese
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon garlic salt
1/4 teaspoon celery salt
1/2 teaspoon dry mustard
1/8 teaspoon pepper
3/4 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
1/8 teaspoon tabasco sauce
recipeText: Mix in a blender.

ingredientList:
2 packages crescent roll dough
2 packages 8-oz cream cheese
1/2 package Hidden Valley Ranch dressing mix
1/3 to 1/2 cup miracle whip dressing
shredded cheese
vegetables - carrots, broccoli, cauliflower, onions, olives, etc.
recipeText:
1st layer - Pat crescent rolls flat on baking sheet. Bake 10 to 12 minutes.

2nd layer - Combine cream cheese, hidden valley ranch mix, and miracle whip. Spread on baked dough.
3rd layer - Spread shredded cheese.
4th layer - Add chopped veggies.

ingredientList:
2 packages crescent roll dough
8 ounces cream cheese, softened
1/2 ounce ranch salad dressing mix
1/3 cup mayonnaise
1/2 teaspoon dill weed
1/4 teaspoon pepper
1/4 teaspoon garlic salt
Small pieces of cauliflower, broccoli, & carrots
Shredded cheddar cheese
recipeText:
Roll out the dough and bake at 350 degrees for 13 minutes.

Mix the remaining ingredients except cheese and veggies.  Spread cream cheese mix on cooled crust.  

Spread cheese and veggies over the cream cheese mix.  Cut and serve.

ingredientList:
1/3 cup chopped green peppers (not to small) more like chunks
1 13 1/2 oz pineapple chunk (in heavy syrup)
Drain and combine the juice with the following
2 tablespoons cornstarch
1/2 cup brown sugar
1/3 cup vinegar
1/3 cup soy sauce
recipeText:
Mix well, heat to boiling, boil for 2 minutes.
Add pineapple chunks and green pepper. Pour over meatballs and cook for several hours.

I did mine in the oven at about 300-325 degrees. (I always use more pineapple and more green pepper, so probably more cause as well.)

ingredientList:
1 envelope Lipton Herb and Garlic Soup Mix
1 (16-ounce) container sour cream
1 cup ricotta cheese
1 cup mozzarella cheese shredded
1/2 cup pepperoni chopped
recipeText:
In a shallow 1-quart casserole dish, combine soup mix, sour cream, ricotta cheese, 3/4 cup mozzarella cheese, and 1/4 cup pepperoni.

Sprinkle 1/4 cup Mozzarella cheese and 1/4 cup pepperoni on top.

Serve Hot with slices of Italian or French bread or favorite cracker.

ingredientList:
Crust:
2 cups flour
1 cup brown sugar
1/2 cup butter
Pecans

Topping:
2/3 cup butter
1/2 cup brown sugar
1 cup choc chips
recipeText:
To make the crust, combine flour, brown sugar, butter.  Pat into a 9 x 13 pan. Sprinkle a layer of pecans over crust.

Make the topping by combining the butter and brown sugar; boil for 1 minute.
Spread on crust.

Bake at 350 degrees for 18 to 20 minutes.

Remove bars from oven and immediately sprinkle chocolate chips on top. 
Let stand for a few minutes to melt the chocolate, then take a spoon and spread the chocolate over the bars.

ingredientList:
Crust:
1 box yellow cake mix
1/3 cup soft margarine
1 egg

Filling:
1 14-oz can sweetened condensed milk
1 cup pecans chopped
1/2 cup Bits O'Brickle baking chips (Heath English Toffee Bits)
recipeText:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.

Grease a 9 x13 pan.

Mix together the crust ingredients and press into the bottom of the pan.

Mix filling ingredients and pour filling over crust.

Bake for 25 to 30 minutes.

ingredientList:
Crust:
1 box yellow cake mix
1/3 cup soft margarine
1 egg

Filling:
1 14-oz can sweetened condensed milk
1 cup pecans chopped
1/2 cup Bits O'Brickle baking chips (Heath English Toffee Bits)
recipeText:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.

Grease a 9 x13 pan.

Mix together the crust ingredients and press into the bottom of the pan.

Mix filling ingredients and pour filling over crust.

Bake for 25 to 30 minutes.

ingredientList:
1 cup butter
8 (8-oz) envelopes Nestle Choco Bake, unsweetened chocolate flavor
4 eggs
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
2 1/2 cups sugar
1 1/2 cups flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 cup chopped nuts
recipeText:
In a small saucepan, melt butter, remove from heat. Stir in Nestle Choco Bake, cool completely. 

In small mixer bowl, beat eggs and vanilla. Gradually add sugar, beating until pale yellow. 

Blend in chocolate mixture. Gradually add flour and salt. Stir in nuts. 

Spread in greased 13" x 9" pan. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

ingredientList:
Date Mixture:
1 cup chopped dates
1 1/2 cups Boiling water
1 teaspoon baking soda

1/2 cup shortening
1 cup sugar
2 egg

1 1/2 cups flour sifted
3/4 teaspoon baking soda
1/4 tsp salt


Topping:
1 package chocolate chips
1/2 cup walnuts
1/2 cup sugar
recipeText:
Create the date mixture by pouring boiling water over the dates and 1 teaspoon baking soda.  Let cool.

Cream together the shortening and sugar.  Add eggs and beat well.  Add dates and water mixture.

Add flour, 3/4 teaspoon baking soda, and salt, beat together well.

Pour into greased and floured 13x9 pan.

Sprinkle chocolate chips, nuts, and 1/2 cup sugar on top.

Bake at 350 in greased pan for 40 minutes.

ingredientList:
1 1/2 cups sugar coated chopped dates
3/4 cup butter
1 tablespoon lemon juice
2 cups flour
1/2 cup salt
3/4 cup firmly packed brown sugar
3/4 cup soft butter or margarine
1 cup coconut
1/2 cup coconut
1/2 cup chopped nuts
recipeText:
Bring dates and water to a boil in a saucepan, Simmer stirring constantly until thick. Remove from heat. Stir in lemon juice.

In a Large mixer bowl combine flour, salt, brown sugar, and butter.

Mix at low speed Mix until resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in coconut and nuts.

Press 1/2 of mixture into bottom of greased 9 x13 pan. Spread date mixture on top, and then sprinkle with remaining crumb mixture.

Press down lightly. 

Bake at 350 degrees for 30 to 35 minutes.

When cool, cut into squares.

ingredientList:
2 1/2 cups flour
1 teaspoon salt
1 cup shortening
1 egg yolk (separate yolk and white, keeping both)
Milk (enough to make 2/3 cup with egg yolk in cup)
Corn flake crumbs
8 - 10 apples
1 cup sugar
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1 egg white
1 cup powdered sugar
Dash vanilla extract
1 teaspoon water
recipeText:
Mix milk and egg yolk, flour, salt, shortening.  Roll 1/2 of dough to fill 10 1/2" x 15 1/2" cookie tray.  Sprinkle bottom of crust with cornflakes.  

Peel and slice apples and place over flakes.  Sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon.  Roll out other half of dough and place on top.  Pinch edges.  Beat egg white stiff and brush over crust. 

Bake at 400 degrees for 60 minutes.

Frosting: Mix powdered sugar, vanilla, and water.  Drizzle frosting over bars.

ingredientList:
1/2 cup butter
1/2 cup sugar
2 cups rice crispy cereal
1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract
6 1/2 ounces dates chopped
1 cup coconut
recipeText:
Cook the butter, sugar and dates until mushy. Add Rice Krispies and vanilla.  These can be pressed into bars, or shaped into small balls ( Walnut size or smaller).

Spread coconut on top, or roll balls in coconut. Do not bake.

Makes about two dozen balls.

ingredientList:
3 well beaten eggs
1 cup sugar
1 cup flour
1/4 teaspoon salt
1 1/2 cups cut up dates
1 teaspoon baking powder
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 cup nuts
recipeText:
Beat eggs with sugar until very thick. Sift in dry ingredients, beat  until smooth. Add vanilla, dates, and nuts.

Bake in a 9 x 13 pan at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes.

While warm, cut bars and roll in Sugar.

ingredientList:
16 ounces dry roasted peanuts
4 tablespoons margarine
12 ounces pkg. peanut butter chips
1 can sweetened condensed milk
10 ounces mini marshmallows
recipeText:
Grease 9x13 pan Put half of the peanuts in the bottom of the pan.

Combine the margarine, milk and chips in a glass bowl. Microwave until melted. Stir in the marshmallows. 

Pour it over the layers of peanuts in the pan. 

Sprinkle the rest of the peanuts over the top. Press these peanuts down with the back of spoon into the mixture.

ingredientList:
3/4 butter or Margarine softened
1 3/4 cups brown sugar packed
3 eggs
1 tablespoon vanilla extract
1 1/2 flour
3 cups walnuts coarsely chopped
1 1/2 candied pineapple coarsely chopped
1 3/4 red and green candied cherries halved
2 cups pitted dates halved
recipeText:
In a mixing bowl, cream the butter and brown sugar. Add the eggs, one at a time. beat well after each addition.

Stir in the vanilla. Add flour and walnuts, mix well. 

Spread evenly into a greased and floured 15" x 10" x 1" baking pan.

Sprinkle with pineapple, cherries and dates, press lightly into the dough. 

Bake at 325 degrees for 45 to 50 minutes or until lightly browned.

Cool before cutting.

ingredientList:
2 eggs
1 1/2 cups sugar
2 1/2 cups flour
1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup walnuts
1 1/2 cups coconut
1 16-ounce can undrained fruit cocktail

Topping:
3/4 cup sugar
1/2 cup butter
1/4 cup Carnation evaporated milk
1/2 cup chopped nuts
1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
recipeText:
Cream eggs and 1 1/2 cups sugar.  Mix with flour, soda, 1 teaspoon vanilla, salt, walnuts, coconut, and fruit cocktail.  

Spread mixture in 2 greased and floured cake pans or 1 jelly roll pan (cookie sheet with sides).  

Bake at 325 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes.  

In the meantime, boil 3/4 cup sugar, butter, Carnation, and 1/2 teaspoon vanilla for two minutes.  Add the 1/2 cup chopped nuts and cool slightly.  

Pour over the fruit cocktail bread while it is still warm.

ingredientList:
2 1/2 cups brown brown sugar
4 eggs
2 cups flour
1 cup chopped nuts
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon lemon juice or orange peel
recipeText:
18 large gumdrops (cut up) or 2 Cups small spiced gum drops

Bake in 9x13 pan Greased and floured

Bake 20-25 Minutes

cut into bars while warm

roll in powdered Sugar

recipeDescription: From Mae Carol, the best elementary school cook ever!
ingredientList:
18 ounces semisweet chocolate chips
3/4 cup peanut butter
3 cups peanuts
2 cups miniature marshmallows
recipeText:
Melt chocolate chips.  Add peanut butter.  Stir in peanuts & marshmallows.  Place in 9" X 13" pan and let cool.

(Alternate: use 12 oz chocolate chips and 6 to 12 oz butterscotch chips.)

ingredientList:
1/2 cup margarine
1 1/2 cups graham cracker crumbs
1 14-ounce can sweetened condensed milk
1 cup semisweet chocolate chips
1 cup walnuts
1 1/3 cups coconut
recipeText:
In a 13" x 9" baking pan, melt margarine.  Sprinkle crumbs over margarine, mix and press into pan.  Pour condensed milk over crumbs.  Top evenly with chocolate chips, walnuts, and coconut.  Press down firmly.

Bake at 350 degrees (325 degrees for glass dish) for 25 to 30 minutes or until lightly browned.  

Cool thoroughly before cutting.  Store loosely covered at room temperature. 

Makes 24 bars.

ingredientList:
1 1/2 cups flour
3/4 cup brown sugar
1/2 cup butter
1 can mixed nuts
1/2 cup white syrup
2 tablespoons butter
6 ounces butterscotch chips
recipeText:
Mix flour, brown sugar, and 1/2 cup butter.  Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes in a 9" x 13" pan.  Cool for 10 minutes.  Spread the nuts over the crust.  

Melt syrup, 2 tablespoons butter, and butterscotch chips over low heat.  Pour over nuts.  

Bank an additional 10 minutes.

ingredientList:
2 cups graham cracker crumbs
1/2 cup powdered sugar
1/2 cup margarine, melted
2 cups coconut
1 can Borden Eagle Brand Sweetened Condensed Milk
1 cup semisweet chocolate chips
4 bars Hershey's chocolate
recipeText:
Mix crackers, powdered sugar, and margarine.  Press in a 12" x 7-1/4" cookie sheet pan.  Bake at 325 degrees for 10 minutes.

Mix coconut and sweetened condensed milk.  Spread on hot crust, bake 10 minutes.

Melt the chocolate chips and chocolate bars.

Spread on hot coconut mix.

Sprinkle with almonds, if desired.

ingredientList:
2 cups graham cracker crumbs
1/2 cup melted butter
1/4 cup sugar
3 cups coconut
1 can sweetened condensed milk
1 tablespoon peanut butter
1 package semisweet chocolate chips
recipeText:
Mix cracker crumbs, sugar, and butter and press hard in a 9" x 13" pan. 
Bake 10 minutes at 350 degrees. 

Mix together coconut and condensed milk and pour over crust. 
Bake for an additional 15 minutes at 350 degrees. 

Melt chocolate chips. Add peanut butter. Pour mixture over the top of the bars. 
Cool and eat!

ingredientList:
1 (12-ounce) bag semisweet chocolate chips
1 (12-ounce) bag butterscotch chips
1 1/2 cups peanut butter
1 cup miniature marshmallows
1 cup peanuts (optional: pecans or walnuts)
recipeText:
Melt the peanut butter, chocolate and butterscotch chips.  

Mix in marshmallows and peanuts.  

Pour into a 9" x 13" pan.  

Cool, cut, and eat.

ingredientList:
1 1/2 cups boiling water
1 cup oatmeal
1/2 cup margarine
1 cup brown sugar
1 cup sugar
2 eggs
1 1/2 cups flour
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon vanilla extract

Frosting:
1/2 cup butter or margarine
1 cup brown sugar, packed
1 tablespoon milk
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 cup coconut
1/2 cup chopped nuts
recipeText:
Pour boiling water over oatmeal and let stand for 20 minutes.  Cream sugar and margarine, beat in eggs, and sifted dry ingredients all at once.  

Add vanilla and beat.  Add oatmeal and water and blend well.  Bake on greased cookie sheet at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.

Frosting:  Boil frosting ingredients except coconut and nuts.  Blend in coconut and nuts and spread on cake while it is still hot.  Cool and Cut.

ingredientList:
1 box orange jello
1 box instant vanilla pudding
1 cup boiling water
1/2 cup cold water
1 cool whip 8-oz
1 cup mini marshmallows
1 can mandarin oranges 14-oz
recipeText:
In a large bowl combine orange jello and boiling water.

Whisk until jello is dissolved.

Add cold water and allow to chill for 15 minutes in refrigerator.

Slowly whisk in vanilla pudding, mix until smooth, and chill for another 15-20 minutes or until it becomes slightly thickened.

Fold in cool whip, mandarin oranges and Marshmallows.

ingredientList:
1 cup corn syrup
1 cup sugar
1 cup peanut butter
6 cups crispy rice cereal
1 cup salted peanuts
1 10-ounce package M&M's
recipeText:
Grease a 9" x 13" pan with butter.

Combine syrup and sugar and peanut butter in a pan.  Heat until melted stirring constantly.  Remove from heat.

Add cereal, peanuts, and M&M's.  Pat into the pan..

ingredientList:
1/2 cup corn syrup
1/2 cup sugar
3/4 cup peanut butter
3 cups crispy rice cereal
1 package semisweet chocolate chips
1/2 package butterscotch chips
recipeText:
Combine syrup and sugar in a pan.  Heat until melted.  Don't boil!  Remove from heat.

Add peanut butter and mix throughly.  

Fold in cereal and pat into a buttered pan.  

Melt the chips and pour over top.

ingredientList:
Dough:
2 3 Oz Package cream cheese
1/2 pound butter
2 cups flour

Filling:
1 3/4 Cup light brown sugar
2 eggs
2 Tablespoons butter
1 Teaspoon Vanilla
pinch of salt
1 cup pecans, chopped
recipeText:
Grease tart pans lightly. Cream butter and cream cheese, add flour and mix well.

Roll dough out to about 1/4 in thick or slightly less.

Cut into fluted or plain cookie cutter and put into small tart pan.

Put about 1/2 teaspoon chopped pecans into each tart.

Beat eggs slightly with fork. Melt butter and add sugar, salt, and vanilla to the eggs.

Put 3/4 teaspoon filling into each tart, on top of chopped nuts. Add a few pecans on top of filling.

Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 Minutes.

Let cool before removing from pan.

ingredientList:
1 package Pecan Frosting Mix
3 cups rolled oats
1 cup margarine
1 cup semisweet chocolate chips
3/4 cup peanut butter
recipeText:
See the Pecan Frosting Mix Substitute recipe.
